intro: ^! I was just talking about you. How are you?"

s: ^Uh oh. I wasn't worried, but now I am.
^I'm great! Knowing I was on your mind? Means I'm doing something right!

Chat1: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "You see, a colleague was telling me how much he worries that his kids hate to cook I was explaining to them that if you can learn, they can learn."

s: ^I have the best teacher, Mr. Calindas. Say, can I ask for advice about medical records?

Chat2: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "Oh. I didn't mean that as a bad thing. Just you didn't know a cucumber from a zucchini. And you took to the kitchen with only a small crash."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "At least while they're at school and have access to the dining hall, his kids won't get scurvy. I hope."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "I reassured him that it's normal for kids to have different interests, and I'm happy to help when someone decides to explore cooking or running."

s: ^I still can't tell a rutabaga from a parsnip, Mr. Calindas.
^Helping with college paperwork is why I'm here. Can we talk medical records?

Chat3: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "Next time I make roasted root vegetables, you can come to the store with me and I'll even show you what a turnip looks like. You know, they're all delicious roasted."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "I suspect that isn't why you're here, though."

s: ^My friend lost her immunization records- I'm trying to help her figure out how to get another copy.

Explain1: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "If you are a patient at the clinic, all of your medical records - including immunizations - are kept in the patient portal. Visit the website to create an account."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "With your name, date of birth, and either a social security number, or a patient ID number, you can securely access everything we have on file about you."

s: ^It is! But what if you have moved or changed doctors?
^Yes! But what if what you need isn't in there?

Explain2: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Good catch. That would depend on her prior care provider, some offer their own portals."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "If not, though, she could call her old physician and ask for a physical copy to be mailed. Her parents should know who her pediatrician was."
^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Sometimes replacing lost records requires a little detective work.

s: ^Now I'm a little worried about where all my records are!
^Like if you don't know your whole medical history, you mean?

Suggestion1: ^Mrcalindas_Day 2_Try to keep all of your medical records in a safe place_Elisa2-3

Suggestion1.#: notification Mrcalindas_Day 2_Try to keep all of your medical records in a safe place_Elisa2-3

Suggestion1: ^Mrcalindas?Neutral "There are many reasons medical records get lost. Immigration, adoption or foster care. Doctors' practices close. House fires, even."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "I always recommend that people do their best to keep records in a safe place, but when that doesn't work, we improvise. Or we do the best we can without those records."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "Sometimes that means repeating tests, or getting repeat vaccines."
Suggestion2: ^Mrcalindas_Day 2_If your immunization records are lost, you might need to repeat vaccines. There are also blood tests that can confirm immunity to certain diseases, proving that you are protected._Elisa2-4

Suggestion2.#: notification Mrcalindas_Day 2_If your immunization records are lost, you might need to repeat vaccines. There are also blood tests that can confirm immunity to certain diseases, proving that you are protected._Elisa2-4

Suggestion2: ^Mrcalindas?Smiling "Not exactly. There are two options for recreating lost immuniation records - a blood test to check for immunity, or just getting the vaccine again."

^Mrcalindas?Neutral "Depending on her insurance, it might be less expensive just to repeat the vaccine. There's very little risk involved - a few side effects, like feeling run down for a day or maybe a little fever."

^Mrcalindas?Smiling "The clinic offers access to reduced price vaccines; once she knows which ones she needs, we can figure out what's covered by insurance, and what she would need to cover out of pocket."
^Mrcalindas?Smiling "She could also try a pharmacy- I would tell her to research the pharmacy before she goes, but in general, getting a vaccine from a pharmacist can be an affordable option."

s: ^This has been really helpful, thank you Mr. Calindas!
